title: Vertical tangent of a parametric function

content.question: For what values of t does the curve given by the parametric equations <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EC3@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4076@</annotation> </semantics> </math> have a vertical tangent?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
